pageContext.claim: “The Obama Administration is now accused of trying to give Iran secret access to the financial system of the United States. This is totally illegal. Perhaps we could get the 13 Angry Democrats to divert some of their energy to this 'matter' (as Comey would call it). Investigate!”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. The Treasury Department had granted a license to an Omani bank, in a one-time transaction, convert Iranian bank holdings from Omani rials into euros. The exchange never took place because U.S. banks still did not want to do it despite the license. With their carefully parsed statements, Obama administration certainly were not forthright to lawmakers at the time about the effort. But the granting of the license was not illegal.
